p: Antifeedant activity is common to many lignans with methylenedioxy-benzene moieties [ 390]. Sesamin blocked feeding of the caterpillar Spilarctia obliqua [ 391] and inhibited growth of the silkworm Bombys mori [ 392]. Asarinin, which is identical with (-)-episesamin, exhibited strong antifeedant activity against the flour beetle Tribolium castaneum [ 393] with a very low EC50 of 25 mg/kg. Paulownin, which is 8-hydroxy-sesamin, inhibited the growth of insect larvae [ 394].
